verses.text: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: Thou hast enlarged me \add when I was\add* in distress; Have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
O ye sons of men, how long \add will ye turn\add* my glory into shame? \add How long\add* will ye love vanity, \add and\add* seek after leasing? Selah.
But know that the \sc Lord\sc* hath set apart \add him that is\add* godly for himself: The \sc Lord\sc* will hear when I call unto him.
Stand in awe, and sin not: Commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, And put your trust in the \sc Lord\sc*.
\add There be\add* many that say, Who will shew us \add any\add* good? \sc Lord\sc*, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.
Thou hast put gladness in my heart, More than \add in\add* the time \add that\add* their corn and their wine increased.
I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: For thou, \sc Lord\sc*, only makest me dwell in safety.
